### Steps to reproduce

mkdir .deps
cd .deps
cmake -G Ninja ..\cmake.deps\
ninja

### Expected behavior

`ninja` success.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

0.9.1

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no

### Operating system/version

Windows 10

### Terminal name/version

no

### $TERM environment variable

no

### Installation

no

comment_data.body: looks like libUV is the issue.

This problem was solved:

```doc
D:/wk/3x/Test/20230822/neovim-0.9.1/.deps/build/src/libuv/src/win/fs.c: In function 'fs__fstat_handle':
D:/wk/3x/Test/20230822/neovim-0.9.1/.deps/build/src/libuv/src/win/fs.c:1963:47: error: 'FILE_DEVICE_CONSOLE' undeclared (first use in this function); did you mean 'FILE_DEVICE_MOUSE'?
     statbuf->st_rdev = (file_type == UV_TTY ? FILE_DEVICE_CONSOLE : FILE_DEVICE_NAMED_PIPE) << 16;
                                               ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
                                               FILE_DEVICE_MOUSE
```

But I got a new one. I start to use vs 2022 to build cmakelists.exe successfully. But when I install nvim, it failed:

![image](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/55801796/26b68e96-d118-4f12-b321-f40cb5423d97)

Thx.
Sorry, but this is a tracker for actual bugs, not a support channel. Please ask your questions on Matrix.

It's ok after I save win_config.c as ansi.
thx.

title: `ninja` build error in Windows 10
